_header: Wist every man how brittle were his shinbone
_description: A proverb about awareness of consequences, trans. ‘Si quis sciuisset fragilis quia sura fuisset / Non saltauisset vbi pargere vir potuisset’ — one long couplet

BodDou52.Editions:
Förster,  Max. 
             “Die Mittelenglische Sprichwörtersammlung in Douce 52.” 
             Festschrift zum XII Deutschen Neuphilolgentage in München
                1906.
            E. Stollreither, ed. 
         Erlangen (1906): 40-64: 56.

RylandsLat394.Transcription:
Wyst euer any man how brechell were his shynne bonnolde he neuere
                    lepyn there þat he myȝte gon
RylandsLat394.Editions:
Pantin,  William A. 
             “A Medieval Collection of Latin and English Proverbs…from Rylands
                Latin MS. 394.” 
             Bulletin of the John Rylands Library
         14 (1930): 81-114: 107.
Sisam,  Celia,  and  Kenneth Sisam, eds.  
             The Oxford Book of Medieval English Verse.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1970: 561.
